results.title: The La Liga table of 2023: Atletico Madrid & Barcelona finish level...
results.content:
They finished third overall in 2023, despite conceding the fewest goals (33) of La Ligaâ€™s â€˜bigâ€™ three sides.

Speaking of their two rivals, despite Barcelona clinching the title, they finished 2023 level on points with Diego Simeoneâ€™s Atletico side (88), but sit second in the table with Los Rojiblancos boasting a far more superior goal difference.

Atletico finishing level with Barcelona is a sign of Xaviâ€™s sideâ€™s drop-off in 2023-24, sitting in fourth behind Atleti at the time of writing, while Girona chase Real in second place. [...] Managed by MÃ­chel, Girona put together a quietly impressive 2022-23 season â€“ their first in the top flight since 2019 â€“ and managed a 10th place finish, but have made that look ordinary so far this time around with a vast improvement that is reflected in the 2023 rankings, sitting fourth for the year with 77 points from their 41 games played.

Time will tell if Gironaâ€™s shrewdly assembled and exceptionally well-drilled side can maintain their title push, but sitting level on points with Real after 18 games is certainly a brilliant indicator of their credentials. [...] The big surprise, though, has been the emergence of surprise package Girona in the Spanish top flight. An already impressive 2023 finished spectacularly with them sitting second in La Liga heading into 2024, surpassing everybodyâ€™s expectations.

Weâ€™re not looking at either season today, however. With 2023 out of the way and a new year ushered in, weâ€™re taking a look back at the La Liga standings from the last calendar year in full to see how teams performed and stacked up over 12 months.

Carlo Ancelottiâ€™s side have enjoyed a much more competitive 2023-24 thus far and sit top of the tree, but ultimately struggled to keep pace with both their local and Catalan rivals throughout the year, finishing 10 points behind La Blaugrana last season.

Section Title: Spanish La Liga Winners List > Frequently Asked Questions > Who won La Liga in 2024-25?
Content:
Barcelona won La Liga in the 2024-25 season, securing their 28th title. This was their first title since 2022-23 and marked their return to the summit of Spanish football.
 ... 
Section Title: Spanish La Liga Winners List > Frequently Asked Questions > How many teams compete in La Liga?
Content:
La Liga currently features 20 teams competing in a round-robin format. Each team plays every other team twice (home and away) for a total of 38 matches per season. The team with the most points at the end wins the championship.
Section Title: Spanish La Liga Winners List > ... > What happens if teams finish level on points?
Content:
If teams finish level on points in La Liga, the title is decided by head-to-head record between the tied teams. This differs from other leagues that use goal difference.

Flickâ€™s team overcame a 2-0 deficit to Real Madrid in the seasonâ€™s final El Clasico and then held on for a 4-3 win to boost them well clear of their rivals. Last seasonâ€™s surprise package, Girona, dropped out of the top-four race after finishing third in 2023-24 and were in the mix to be relegated to the Segunda division.

Last season saw Cadiz, Almeria, and Granada relegated, while Leganes, Real Valladolid, and Espanyol came up from Segunda Division. Valladolid and Leganes went back down, joined by Las Palmas as Espanyol stayed out of the bottom three by one point on the final day of the season.

The league is contested on a round-robin basis, with the title awarded to the team that finishes top at the end of the season. First established in 1929 with ten teams, La Liga has featured 20 teams since 1997.

Barcelona is also one of only two European clubsâ€”alongside Bayern Munich, who joined them in 2020â€”to have won the treble twice, most recently in 2015. The current champions are Barcelona, who claimed their 28th title in the 2024â€“25 season. The three lowest-placed teams in La Liga are relegated to the Segunda DivisiÃ³n and replaced by the top three from that division.

snippets: Real Madrid are the most successful team in the history of LaLiga with 36 titles compared to Barcelonaâ€™s 28. Los Blancos claimed their most recent success in the 2023/24 season when Carlo Ancelottiâ€™s side cruised to league glory with 95 points and only one defeat.

They won the league again during the pandemic-impacted 2020/21 season which was played out behind closed doors. That remains the last time a club other than Real Madrid or Barcelona won LaLiga, although unfancied Girona gave it a really good crack during the 2023/24 campaign, finishing in a surprise 3rd place.

The 1930/31 season for instance ended with the top three teams all level on points, but Athletic Club ultimately pipped Racing Santander and Real Sociedad to the title courtesy of a superior H2H goal difference in a season dominated by teams in the north of Spain. The title has never left the Spanish mainland, but Canary Islanders Las Palmas did claim a fantastic 2nd place in the late 1960s, although they never seriously threatened to knock Real Madrid off top spot.

Athletic Club by comparison have an incredible conversion rate of having also won the Copa del Rey in five of the eight seasons that theyâ€™ve won the league, including their most recent league triumph in 1983/84. Atletico Madrid meanwhile have only won the double once, with their 1995/96 â€˜dobleteâ€™ campaign still standing alone as their finest ever season in terms of silverware, although 2013/14 ran it very close! ... Barcelona are the only Spanish team to have completed the treble.

web.description: Kylian Mbappe defends his runaway Pichichi title from last season, but Real Madrid hope that they are able to spread his output around more effectively, leaving the potential for others to give chase.
snippets: After securing a long-awaited move to Real Madrid, Kylian Mbappe won the 2024/25 Pichichi award by scoring six goals more than anyone else across the season. While Mbappe's debut campaign in the Spanish capital was triumphant in this manner, he still garnered significant criticism that his presence hampered the team collectively despite the individual success. Real Madrid finished trophy-less while Mbappe's teammates struggled to adapt to his presence, leaving the individual award with a bitter aftertaste. Artem Dovbyk won the Pichichi prize as the top goalscorer in La Liga for 2023/24.

Kylian Mbappe may have finished the 2024/25 season without a collective trophy at Real Madrid, but his first season in white can be considered an individual success as he ran away with the La Liga top goal scorer award.
The Sporting News will be tracking the Golden Boot race in La Liga from the season's opening kickoff right until the final matchday.
The table below will be updated throughout the 2025/26 La Liga season, which began on August 15.

web.title: Champions League all-time top scorers: Cristiano Ronaldo, Lionel ...
web.description: Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi lead the way for Champions League goals, with Robert Lewandowski now clear in third having brought up his own century. Ronaldo has netted for Manchester United, Real Madrid and Juventus, with Messi on target for Barcelona and Paris Saint-Germain.
snippets: Real Madrid contested just seven games as they won the inaugural edition, compared to 13 en route to their Champions League victory in 2023/24. The all-time European Cup top ï»¿scorer, Alfredo Di StÃ©fano, struck 49 goals in just 58 appearances in the competition, a goals-per-game rate that none of the modern greats can match. Cristiano Ronaldo is the top scorer of all time in the Champions League and UEFA club competition as well as the most prolific in the history of senior international football.

The Polish forward was unable to retain his title the following season, Dortmund's Haaland finishing top of the 2020/21 rankings with ten goals, two more than second-ranked Kylian MbappÃ©, with the two forwards widely predicted to have the same kind of striking competition at the highest level of European football that Ronaldo and Messi enjoyed for more than a decade. That prediction has seemingly played out with Haaland topping the charts again in 2022/23 and MbappÃ© sharing the honour the following year. 2024/25: Raphinha (Barcelona), Serhou Guirassy (Dortmund) â€“ 13 2023/24: Harry Kane (Ba

The Argentinian joined Barcelona in early 2001 when he was just 13, and stuck with the team for the next 20 years, winning the Champions League four times in addition to ten La Liga titles, seven editions of the Copa del Rey and three UEFA Super Cups. He was the second player to reach 100 Champions League goals (after Ronaldo) and has been top scorer (or joint-top scorer) in six Champions League seasons, one fewer than Ronaldo has managed.

Real Madrid won the opening five editions, their Argentinian-born forward Alfredo Di StÃ©fano racking up 49 goals, a tally that no one was able to match in the 37 seasons before the competition was reinvented as the Champions League. The player who initially came closest to taking Di StÃ©fano's record was Portuguese phenomenon EusÃ©bio, the talented striker scoring 47 goals as his Benfica side replaced Madrid as the pre-eminent force in world club football for a time.

snippets: Early in the season, La Liga announced plans for a match between Villarreal and Barcelona, which was to be held on 20 December at Hard Rock Stadium in the Miami metro area in the United States. This was to mark the first La Liga match ever to be played outside of Spain. The match, initially moved out of La CerÃ¡mica, was moved back to Villarreal on 21 October, following protests from La Liga's clubs, players and fans. The final team promoted was Oviedo after overcoming MirandÃ©s 3â€“2 on aggregate in the promotion play-off final on 21 June to return to the top division after a twenty four-year absence. results.title: Real Madrid 2-1 Rayo Vallecano: Kylian Mbappe scores late ... - BBC
results.content:
The reaction inside the Bernabeu is mixed. There is relief, but also clear dissatisfaction with the performance. Real Madrid didnâ€™t make it easy for themselves today.

I'm heading off to the press conference to hear what Arbeloa has to say. He will have a lot to answer for.

### FULL-TIMEpublished at 15:12 GMT 1 February 15:12 GMT 1 February

Real Madrid 2-1 Rayo Vallecano

Full-time! Real Madrid squeeze past strugglers Rayo Vallecano to cut Barcelona's lead at the top of La Liga down to a single point.

Goals from Kylian Mbappe and Vinicius Jr secure victory for Alvaro Arbeloa's side.

La Liga table

### RED CARDpublished at 90 + 12 mins 90 + 12 mins

Real Madrid 2-1 Rayo Vallecano [...] # Mbappe injury-time penalty gives Real Madrid laboured win

## Match Summary

### Key Events

#### Real Madrid

#### Rayo Vallecano

## Summary

Rayo Vallecano level with Real Madrid but down to 10 men in La Liga

Pathe Cisse sent off for visitors after Jorge de Frutos equaliser

Vinicius Jr had given hosts first-half lead

Jude Bellingham replaced on 10 minutes after hamstring injury

Victory will move Ãlvaro Arbeloa's side back to within one point of leaders Barcelona

## Live Reporting

Keifer MacDonald

### Thanks for followingpublished at 15:38 GMT 1 February 15:38 GMT 1 February

That's all for our coverage of Real Madrid v Rayo Vallecano in La Liga.

See you again soon!

### What's next for Real Madrid?published at 15:27 GMT 1 February 15:27 GMT 1 February [...] FT: Real Madrid 2-1 Rayo Vallecano

After this dramatic, late victory against Rayo Vallecano, Real Madrid will have a couple of days to regroup ahead of next weekend's game against Valencia.

Alvaro Arbeloa's side then face Real Sociedad, Benfica (UCL) and Osasuna next.

### Full-time thoughtspublished at 15:16 GMT 1 February 15:16 GMT 1 February

FT: Real Madrid 2-1 Rayo Vallecano

Elizabeth Conway  
BBC Sport Spanish football reporter at the Bernabeu

You have to say Real Madrid deserved to win the match. They completely dominated the second half and should have won the game by a far greater margin.

The significance of Mbappeâ€™s late goal might only be fully appreciated later in the season.

It keeps Real Madrid within one point of Barcelona at the top of the table.

web.title: Real Madrid 2-1 Rayo Vallecano: Kylian Mbappe scores late penalty ...
web.description: Kylian Mbappe scores a penalty in stoppage time as Real Madrid labour to a narrow win over nine-man Rayo Vallecano.
snippets: Real Madrid squeeze past strugglers Rayo Vallecano to cut Barcelona's lead at the top of La Liga down to a single point. Goals from Kylian Mbappe and Vinicius Jr secure victory for Alvaro Arbeloa's side. ... Drama! Rayo Vallecano are reduced to nine men as Pep Chavarria is shown a second yellow card for pushing Rodrygo! ... Kylian Mbappe and Rodrygo are trying to run down the clock in the final few seconds and see out the win for Real Madrid.

Surely, that should be that for Real Madrid! Kylian Mbappe sends Augusto Batalla the wrong way from the spot to score his 22nd La Liga goal of the season. ... Brahim Diaz wins a penalty in the final minutes!

What can Real do with these final nine minutes? Can Rayo Vallecano hold on? ... Madrid are desperately trying to win this! They are camped inside the Vallecano half as the clock ticks towards 90 minutes. ... Mbappe goes down inside the area but the referee says no penalty! ... Rayo Vallecano know exactly what they are doing. A point today, against Real Madrid, could be the difference between relegation and staying in La Liga.

Kylian Mbappe scored a stoppage-time penalty to seal Real Madrid's win against nine-man Rayo Vallecano, after Jude Bellingham was forced off with injury. Nobel Mendy's foul on Brahim Diaz in the 100th minute gave Mbappe the chance to put Real to within one point of Barcelona in the La Liga title race.

web.title: Goals and Highlights: Real Madrid 2-1 Rayo Vallecano in LaLiga ...
web.description: Rayo Vallecano played a great game, however it was a foul inside the area that ended up giving Real Madrid the opportunity to emerge victorious, a situation that MbappÃ© did not waste, and the visitors finished with 9 men.
snippets: It's Kylian MbappÃ© who takes the ball, places it on the penalty spot and shoots powerfully towards the goal, the ball goes to the opposite side from where Courtois dives and thus manages to score the second. Penalty for Real Madrid! It was Brahim DÃ­az who was trying to control the ball inside the opponent's area, however Mendy tries to take the ball from him and ends up kicking the player, the referee does not hesitate and awards the penalty.

It was Kylian MbappÃ© who was looking to create enough danger to put the second goal on the scoreboard, what a great shot he managed to send from outside the area, but the ball crashes against the crossbar and goes far away. The visitors are looking to add to their tally! What a great assist from Pedro DÃ­az up front! The ball reached Andrei Ratiu with a dangerous shot, but his left-footed effort was saved, preventing a second goal. Real Madrid make a substitution, the home side changing their starting eleven to look for more attacking threat.

Madrid already had another interesting chance with Arda GÃ¼ler creating some promising moments, but Dean Huijsen's shot went wide. What a moment. It's a constant back and forth, both teams are looking for a way to score, however the ball doesn't want to go in to score another goal, time is passing and the teams can't find a way to go for more .

Rayo Vallecano tried for the goal that would equalize the score, after turning around Ãlvaro GarcÃ­a managed to send a tremendous shot towards the goal, however Courtois ended up getting ahead and protecting the ball well. Real Madrid continue stringing passes together, searching for a way to score their second goal.
